cz.hobrasoft.pdfmu

Class TextOutput

  • java.lang.Object
    • cz.hobrasoft.pdfmu.TextOutput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Flushable

    public class TextOutput
extends Object
implements Flushable
    Prints indented messages to a PrintStream

    The indentation level starts at 0 and can be changed using indentMore() and indentLess().

    Example of usage: 

     
 TextOutput to = new TextOutput(System.out);
 to.println("Hello!");
 to.indentMore("My favorite fruits:");
 to.println("Banana");
 to.println("Apple");
 to.indentLess();
 to.flush();
    Author:
    Filip Bartek

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextOutput()
      Creates a TextOutput that discards all the messages

    • Method Detail

      • println

        public void println(String x)
        Prints a message on a separate line

        The message is indented by the current indentation level (starting at 0) and printed using the specified PrintStream.

        Mimics PrintStream.println(String x).

        Parameters:
        x - message to print

      • indentMore

        public void indentMore()
        Increments the indentation level

        If the code between indentMore() and indentLess() may throw a (checked) exception, surround the code with a try-finally block like this to maintain consistency: 

         
 TextOutput to;
 to.indentMore();
 try {
   // Do stuff, possibly throwing an exception
 // Possibly catch the exception
 } finally {
   to.indentLess();
 }

      • indentMore

        public void indentMore(String message)
        Prints a message and increments the indentation level
        Parameters:
        message - message to print

      • indentLess

        public void indentLess()
        Decrements the indentation level

      • flush

        public void flush()
           throws IOException
        Flushes the underlying PrintStream
        Specified by:

        Throws:
